question.text: Triploid tissue will be observed in -

solution.text: Double fertilization is a unique characteristic observed in the Angiosperm group of plants. In this, two fertilizations are observed - <math><msup><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">t</mi></mrow></msup></math> between the female and male gametic cells forming zygote and <math><msup><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">d</mi></mrow></msup></math> is between the second male gamete and polar nuclei forming the primary endosperm nucleus. The ploidy of PEN is 3n (male gamete <math><mo>[</mo><mn>1</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><mo>]</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mo>+</mo></math> polar nuclei <math><mo>[</mo><mn>2</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><mo>]</mo></math> ).
